title.rendered: GRIFFON CH-146 MISSION REHEARSAL TACTICS TRAINER

content.rendered:
PROUDLY PRESENTING

GRIFFON CH-146 MISSION REHEARSAL TACTICS TRAINER

Dymech worked with the Department of National Defence (DND), CAE, and members of the Advanced Cognitive Engineering Laboratory (ACE Lab) to design and prototype a cockpit structure to simulate the interior of a Griffon CH-146 helicopter. The result was a functional, effective design and three fully operational units for immediate use by the client group.

The CH-146 cockpit interior structure as well as flight instruments and controls were first defined in a computer model which was used to evaluate the realism and functionality of the cockpit layout. Drawings, photographs, laser-scans, and feedback from pilots were used to create this model (image 2).

The three-dimensional CAD model was also used to optimize the location and arrangement of the monitors with respect to Field of View (FOV) (image 3).

In addition, the CAD model was instrumental in providing the simulator programmers with the locations of each screen so that the properly oriented and synchronized image could be displayed with respect to the user (image 4).

The monitor support frame was developed to work with, but be separate from, the Cockpit Simulator. This allows different monitor configurations to be swapped in and out, and allows for easier upgrading when new technology becomes available (image 5).

Six large LCD screen monitors produce an immersive FOV for the users (image 6).

Three touchscreen displays were included to simulate the flight instrumentation and the dashboard controls (image 7).
